snippet: In New Jersey, Gov. Chris Christie won 50 percent of Latino voters, while in Virginia, Latinos voted heavily against Kenneth T. Cuccinelli II, who lost his election.
abstract: Republicans in Congress studying results from governors' elections in New Jersey and Virginia see two starkly different test cases for how party should move on immigration; New Jersey Gov Christ Christie won blowout victory in part because he won half of Latino voters, while Virginia hopeful Atty Gen Kenneth T Cuccinelli II narrowly lost in part because Latino voters turned out and voted heavily against him.

byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: In New Jersey, Gov. Chris Christie won 50 percent of Latino voters, while in Virginia, Latinos voted heavily against Kenneth T. Cuccinelli II, who lost his election.

headline.main: Lessons on Immigration in Two Governors’ Races
headline.print_headline: Lessons on Immigration In Two Governors’ Races
